label: Component
description: A LIS:PhysicalObject that may have some OMPD:ResourceRole
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: an item of hardware, software or both that can be individually described and has a required function
example: a circuit board, a pump shaft, a resistor, a cable

label: Hazard
description: An LIS: Realizeable Entity that is realizrd in some OMPD: Hazard Realization Process
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: source or situation with a potential to cause injury and ill health (ISO 45001:2018)
example: oil on the floor, a heavy object that needs to be moved, a high pressure pipe

label: HazardInMaintenanceProcess
description: An OMPD: Hazard that is realized in some OMPD: Hazard Realization Process that occurs relative to some OMPD: Maintenance Process
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: source or situation with a potential to cause injury and ill health identified in a maintenance procedure (ISO 45001:2018)
example: a confined space, working at heights, pressurised containers

label: HazardRealizationProcess
description: An LIS: Activity that has the potential to cause harm
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the process in which the hazard is realised and harm occurs
example: a slip on the oil, the lifting of the too-heavy object, the unconstrained release of pressure

label: MaintainableItem
description: An LIS:PhysicalObject hat has a role OMPD:MaintainableItemRole
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: an item (system or component) for which a maintenance strategy has been identified  (IOF Core Ontology)
example: a mechanical seal, a motor, tyres on a car

label: MaintainableItemRole
description: An LIS:Role that is the role of the item that work is performed on in a OMPD:MaintenanceProcess
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: role played by an item when there is a maintenance strategy describing how it is to be maintained (IOF Core Ontology)
example: a pump has the maintainable material item role when it is undergoing repair after a failure, a bearing has a maintainable material item role when it is been lubricated as part of a preventative maintenance program

label: MaintenanceProcedureDocument
description: An LIS:InformationObject that is about some OMPD:MaineanceProcedureProcess
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a digital or paper document describing a task or set of tasks for a maintainer to perform
example: a document describing how to change the oil in the car, or to replace the coupling on a pump

label: MaintenanceProcedureProcess
description: An OMPD:MaintenanceProcess that is represented in some OMPD:MaintenanceProcedureDocument and has activity part some OMPD:MaintenanceTask
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a process containing the steps described in the maintenance procedure as activity parts
example: engine replacement process

label: MaintenanceProcess
description: An LIS: Activity, intended to repair or restore an item to a state in which it can perform its required function
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the activities involved in restoring or retaining the function of an item (IOF Maintenance Reference Ontology)
example: repair the laptop, replace the window frame, inspect the fluid level

label: MaintenanceTask
description: An OMPD:MaintenanceProcess that is: - a direct activity part of zero or one OMPD:MaintenanceProcedureProcess - an activity part of zero or more OMPD:MaintenanceProcedureProcess - a direct activity part of zero or one OMPD:MaintenanceTask - an activity part of zero or more OMPD:MaintenanceTask - occurs directly before zero or one Maintenance task - occurs before zero or more MaintenanceTask - occurs directly after zero or one MaintenanceTask - occurs after zero or more OMPD:MaintenanceTask
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a discrete activity within a multi-step maintenance process
example: shut-off the valve, remove the bolts from the cover, replace the shaft

label: MaintenanceTaskDescription
description: An LIS:InformationObject that is about some OMPD:MaintenanceTask
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the part of a document containing instructions for performing a maintenance task
example: the section in a maintenance procedure description that describes an individual task in the process

label: Material
description: A LIS:PhysicalObject that may have some OMPD:ResourceRole
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: items (generally consumables) that are required for the maintenance procedure to be executed that cannot be individually described according to its primary function (generally consumables).
example: sheet metal, oil, lubricant

label: Permit
description: A LIS:InformationObject that  may have some OMPD:ResourceRole
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a document containing approval to progress a task
example: confined space entry permit, hot work permit

label: Qualification
description: A LIS:Quality that is beared by zero or more OMPD:QualitifiedPerson
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a capability of an individual to perform a specific task that has been assessed by a recognised 3rd party group
example: an electrical engineering qualification, a welding certificate

label: QualifiedPerson
description: A LIS:Person that may have some OMPD:ResourceRole and has a OMPD:Qualification
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the person recognised by a 3rd party group as having a specific capability
example: a mechanical engineer, an electrician, a machinist

label: Resource
description: An LIS: Object that has some OMPD: Resource Role
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a tool, material, equipment or person required to complete a maintenance task
example: a crane, welding rods, a multi-meter, mechanic

label: ResourceRole
description: An LIS:Role that is the role of an LIS:Object that is required to execute some LIS:Activity
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the role played by an object when it is required in the execution of a the maintenance task (and is not the equipment being worked on)
example: a spanner has a resource role when it is required for disassembling an engine

label: Tool
description: A LIS:PhysicalObject that  may have some OMPD:ResourceRole
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a physical object designed to perform a specific function involved in a maintenance task, usually hand-held
example: a wrench, a hammer, a screwdriver

label: MaintenanceAction
description: An LIS:Activity that is a maintenance activity or a supporting activity involved in execution of a maintenance task
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a context-agnostic maintenance activity or supporting activity that is described within a maintenance task
example: repair, replace, lubricate, clean, move

label: ItemInMaintenanceProcess
description: A LIS:PhysicalObject that partiticipates in some OMPD:MaintenanceProcess
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: a physical object that is involved in some part of a maintenance task

label: MaintenanceTaskDescriptionMedia
description: An LIS:InformationObject has some proc:MediaType and is part of some OMPD:MaintenanceTaskDescription
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: an descriptive information object of one media type that forms part of a maintenance task description
example: An image of the engine that is being worked on in a "disassemble the engine" maintenance task.

label: MediaType
description: An LIS:InformationObject that is a type of media
subjectMatterExpertExplanation: the format of a section of a maintenance procedure that describes an individual task in the process
example: image, text, video
